TopicTitle: In the pool of whiney threads...

Articles.Content:
... there's a thread with the sole purpose of praising/bragging.

Despite the fact that I never played with FAR or NEAR, I haven't flipped one single rocket launch in 1.0. Or 1.0.1. Or 1.0.2.

PS: KSP is awesome.

Ta.
In 1.02, I launched a SSTO plane into orbit while drunk last night.

> 
> In 1.02, I launched a SSTO plane into orbit while drunk last night.

Me too, only using monoprop. Burning retrograde.

I've been enjoying flying planes in the new atmosphere. Who needs a flight sim when you can go IVA with the MK1 Inline, build a nice, sturdy design of plane, and bumble about in the sky for an hour or two.
Is the whole updating frenzy over? I haven't touched KSP since the day 1.0.1. came out. Are we safe now?
There is a lull but but I'm keeping my head down until 1.0.3...

> 
> In 1.02, I launched a SSTO plane into orbit while drunk last night.

What quality and quantity of liquid er... fuel I need to consume to reproduce your success? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I'm loving the new system. I have a working SSTO spaceplane, and a shuttle (vertical launch, "gliding" landing), all stock, no mods at all yet. 

![screenshot8_zpslbvylbte.png](http://i289.photobucket.com/albums/ll203/goestrider/screenshot8_zpslbvylbte.png)

And I've never been able to do that before, modded or stock. 

So thank you squad for making KSP new (to me) again.

> 
> Is the whole updating frenzy over? I haven't touched KSP since the day 1.0.1. came out. Are we safe now?

I think you are safe now, join us.

Launched a small probe into a mostly polar orbit on the first try. My main problems were that I somehow couldn't make it a 100% polar orbit, and that my trajectory wasted way too much fuel, resulting in me being unable to fix that issue.

Now, I managed to mostly curb those two issues. 1.0.2: Best. Update. Ever.
Hooray for new aero update! Pancaking is a thing of the past now I guess?

> 
> I think you are safe now, join us.

You sound creepy. Explain yourself. ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)
